fields.description:
Once you have [integrated Jira Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/3xNqCw], creating issues from a Crucible comment can result the permission error dialog (see the attached screen shot).

Please see this [knowledge base entry|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/KYT-Cw] for Symptoms and resolution.
fields.summary: Permission error when creating sub task from Crucible comment

fields.description:
1. link provides CSV export
2. first three columns of the table sortable
3. events belonging to the current user are hilighted
4. deep link to the review where possible
fields.summary: improvements to the history dialog
Transactions don't nest

fields.description:
Considering Atlassian's ownership of both products, and strong history with Jira, the integration between Crucible and Jira for creation of subtasks for defects is very lame.

* Sub-Task should inherit "fix-for" version of parent task

* Sub-Task should be assigned to code (defect) author, rather than left unassigned.  Better yet, config in Crucible should let you choose whether the assignee  defaults to the change author or the defect reporter, etc.

For 2.1 we will do the inherit fix-for option and investigate the second (do if we can - it will be for trusted apps only).
fields.summary: Crucible's Jira Integration (Defect -> SubTask Creation) Very Weak

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a project e.g named 'MyProject' with the key 'MP'
# Create a review under the 'MyProject'
# Setup the Jira integration with mappings (but without any default mapping)
# Go to project list to rename the MyProject's key to 'MPS'
# Go to {{Admin >  JIRA Servers >  Edit default JIRA Server mappings}}, under the crucible project list, it still shows the old project key 'MP'
# Even if you remove the project, the keys still exist at the crucible project list
fields.summary: Deleted project still shows at the default JIRA Server mappings
Objectives section needs a permalink icon, top right

fields.description: Both FishEye and Crucible diffs have a column for + and - which are completely redundant. remove from all diffs.
fields.summary: remove + and - from diff.

fields.description: table of participants with some metrics about each, completedness, last activity, etc, and then also some review metrics - number of files, LOC, number of comments & defects.  We need a permalink to this information.
fields.summary: make a meta-data node in the review overview

fields.description: mouse-over hint to click to edit.  Let's this just do this in the review page first.  that is ignore edit details for this iteration.  Remember the linkers !!!
fields.summary: Review Title should be editable inline in review page

fields.description: mouse-over hint to click to edit.
fields.summary: Objectives and Summary should be editable (with wiki rendered preview) inline in the overview frx section

fields.description: only one gutter per FRX (rather than a gutter per revision as it is now). two icon shapes, 1. comments on visible lines, 2. comments on non-visible lines. two icon colours: 1. defect, 2. normal comment. comment count to appear inside the shape. icon to only appear at the first line. fix hover behaviour: if a comment is already visible, don't put the hover comment as well, just hilight the existing comment. link "see in context" on hovered comment opens appropriate revisions.
fields.summary: Simplify the tetris bar visualisation

fields.description: under project admin. make sure they can be "cleared".  Prepend to any objectives that are supplied on review creation (eg via JIRA).
fields.summary: Default objectives can be set on a per-project basis

fields.description: Use a "sticky header" when scrolling in multi-FRX mode (think iphone calendar). That is, the FRX header "sticks" to the top of the pane when it is scrolled to the top. See Matt's discussion on EAC. When it stops at the top, it gets decorated with more controls (revision slider, mark unread etc). Comment count including unread in () to be on display always on FRX header
fields.summary: FRX header overhaul
Allow detailed logging of requests to SCM plugins

however {{jiraServerType.getJiraMappings()}} can return null.

fields.description: for admin docs, need to update this page http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Properties

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a project with same project key as one of the Jira project key, e.g MPC.
# Setup the Jira server integration, map the Crucible project key with Jira project key.
# Do a commit with the issue key MPC-123 in it, and see that it links to Crucible review.
# Then rename the MPC project's key to something else, say, MPC2. MPC-123 still links to Crucible instead of Jira.
# Deleting the project fixes the linking back to jira.

Besides, if the 'Default Mappings for JIRA Projects ' was set before removing the project key, it still shows at the {{'Admin >  View JIRA Servers >  Map JIRA Project Defaults > Choose Crucible Project'}} list after the project key is being removed.
fields.summary: Issue link conflicts when the project key same with the Jira project key

fields.description: Crucible is generating what is technically invalid RSS. In the specification, inside of the ... ... element, any HTML needs to be entity-escaped; it's definitely not, at least, when there's a linked jira issue in the title, such as: <title>NPCR-98: <span class="crulinkspan">NGP-2978</span> - more copy here Sample URL: http:///fisheye/cru/rssReviewFilter?filter=outForReview&FEAUTH= Certain RSS readers handle that better than others. Consider it's a span tag, and there's no styling in the RSS feed, it would seem easiest to simply remove that span tag rather than escape it, as it adds no value. In this case, I'm using a Yahoo Widget to monitor the open code reviews, and that widget doesn't handle this span tag very well - which is their fault, but technically this RSS is not spec-compliant, so I deemed it worthy of an issue with Atlassian as well.
fields.summary: Crucible RSS Feeds not compliant with RSS specification - un-escaped HTML span tags in channel/item/title

fields.description:
At the moment we only state that we support Mysql and Postgres, but do not specify which versions we support. 

We need to clearly state which versions we test against and which versions we support.
fields.summary: Document supported database versions

fields.description:
When you've first opened a review using ] or n to go to the next comment doesn't work.

You need to be in "file" mode rather the overview before it'll work.
fields.summary: ] + n doesn't work when the screen initially opens

fields.description:
So I accidentally messed up when creating our crucible project and used the same key (MCH) as our jira project.  This broken our integration when viewing commit logs. (Prior to creating the crucible project our jira integration was working perfectly -- i could mouse over the key e.g. MCH-1999 and it would grab the details and put it into the mouseover window). 

I quickly recognized what I did and edited the crucible project and changed the key to MCHCRU, however the linking didn't come back?  I can click on the MCHCRU-NNN and it will take me to the crucible review, however when i mouse over a MCH-NNNN link in a commit log it says "review not found".

I tried to re-index the crucible database, however it still seems broken.

If I define a linker at the repository default level then the links will go to the jira server, however the mouseover doesn't work in that case.

Any ideas how I can fix this?
fields.summary: JIRA Integration broke after accidentally defining cruicible project key the same as our jira key.

fields.description: The review timer seems to display 0 minutes when the review has been idle for a while. The actual time does come back after a while when I return to a review so it's most likely a display issue while in idle.
fields.summary: Review timer goes to 0 minutes when review is idle
remove content/images/gadgets when possible

fields.description: hunks are rendered as "document fragments", FRX Header is the "top fragment".  This is just the "tearing" visual style that Sharkie has been working on.  There are some issues here that sharkie has raised to make this happen

fields.description: Let's dogfood this early since we are not convinced.  We want to support reordering as a response to polling

Review page top section re-org

fields.description:
Dialog title should include review ID, review state, comment counts. LHS should have only two top-level entries: Review detail, and Review Content. All "content choosing" options should be subordinate or available on the RHS when Review Content is selected.
This is really about the shell of the dialog, ie massaging the menu structure
fields.summary: Edit Review dialog overhaul

fields.description:
Above the line / below the line approach to mandatory fields (all mandatory fields above an imaginary line). Most fields are displayed as non-editable with mouse-over to hint click to edit. All participant selection using same type of widget (text field with auto-complete). Reviewer selection has single auto-complete text field, with two buttons next to it "add", "suggest...". Reviewers are listed without checkboxes. mouse-over reviewer reveals "remove" hint (red x) to remove the reviewer. Ask Brendan to mock up on whiteboard.
See whiteboard photo on the story
The editible versus view mode of fields depends on the state of the review.  
The 'Allow anyone to Join' checkbox needs to be separated from the list of the reviewers so that it does not get lost in the list of reviewers.
fields.summary: Edit Details pane overhaul
getReviewsAsRolesInStates is extremely inefficient.
Exception editing a review with Uploads

fields.description: Brendan and Matt have been bouncing ideas to improve the FRX look and feel - incorporate these and build on the strategy
fields.summary: Augment UI of FRX items to create a more unified, page-like approach

fields.description:
...or should the api return formatted HTML (like JIRA)? Or should we make that a parameter for clients to choose?

Background:
5:21:04 PM Paul Slade: erik, what is the plan re wiki markup and the REST api?
5:21:24 PM Paul Slade: can we strip the wiki markup for REST calls?  eg from comments
5:21:31 PM Erik van Zijst: wiki in rest?
5:21:32 PM Erik van Zijst: ah
5:21:35 PM Paul Slade: was there a story for this>
5:21:55 PM Erik van Zijst: no idea.. maybe that makes sense.. but then again.. maybe not so much 
5:21:56 PM Paul Slade: because we are getting a demo from the poles right now and we see {preserve-old} everywhere 
5:22:08 PM Paul Slade: in the connector
5:22:28 PM Erik van Zijst: I understand.. so yeah maybe we could strip it out
5:22:37 PM Erik van Zijst: no idea how difficult that would be though
5:23:25 PM Erik van Zijst: how does jira do this? as in: if the connectors pulls in comments on jira issues with wiki markup, is that filtered out?
5:28:14 PM Paul Slade: i'll ask
5:32:16 PM Paul Slade: The connector gets JIRA descriptions and JIRA comments in HTML.
5:32:33 PM Paul Slade: so if we could convert the wiki markup to HTML then that would be a win for the connector
5:33:23 PM Paul Slade: but we need to support wiki markup-ed comment submission via the rest apo
5:33:24 PM Paul Slade: api
5:33:32 PM Erik van Zijst: yes, but not necessarily for other clients.. still a valid point though. maybe html/raw-wiki should be a parameter
5:34:02 PM Paul Slade: indeed
fields.summary: SPI and REST should additionally return rendered HTML for wiki markup comments and other stuff

fields.description:
I view a review file with 2 revisions included in the review (A and B), and a later revision not in the review (C).
I click "File Outdated -> Add Latest".
The revision slider now shows revisions A, B, C and indicates that the displayed diff is between A and C (which is as I expect), however the displayed diff seems to be between B and C.
If I reload the page, the revision slider shows that the displayed diff is between B and C.
fields.summary: Adding the latest revision to an existing review file results in incorrect diff being displayed and inaccurate revisions slider

fields.description: In order to finalise the push to having FRXs look and behave more like documents and document shards, we need to provide structure and hooks for styling. A construct similar to the skipped row will work best: {code}         ... {code} Rows, TRs, with on of these four classes as appropriate would work well # diffStarted # diffStartSkipped # diffEndSkipped # diffEnded These would work with diffSkipped to provide a full set of hooks

Add colspan to context rows in FRXes

fields.description:
Table rows used to describe the diffs in an FRX line use commas in the ID where a line contains both a from and to number and start all IDs with a numeral.

This is invalid and a potential cause of conflict should we be trying to interact with a specific ID using jQuery. From its perspective $("#19150_lineBoth27,22") is one element with an ID of 19150_lineBoth27 and another with a tag name of 22. Both of which are invalid and neither of which can be found.

Something like frx19150_line27_line22 would be both valid and would let us do a split on "_line" to get [1] and [2] for the line numbers. This model would also let us add in any number of _line components if the need arises 

!http://img.skitch.com/20090831-b9gjke9tct5r3gtgquihwkye26.jpg!
fields.summary: Remove commas from IDs in FRXs, and add a valid leading character

Investigation shows a STRONG element can be used to provide style and meaning in both cases.

!http://img5.imagebanana.com/img/ynlw2cbi/screenshot_001.png!

fields.description:
A suggestion was raised that we add the ability to download a copy of all the source code under review.

This would allow for offline perusal of the files and the ability to view the files in their entirety as an aid to reviewing.

I imagine it might be convenient to get something like a zip file that contains all the files.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
1. Create a review with a single file.
2. Click 'Edit Revisions' for that file.
3. Click the 'x' next to each revision in the slider to remove all the revisions, and hence the file, from the review.

*Expected behaviour*
- After removing the last revision, the file should be removed from the review
- The review overview should be focused
- The frx controls area should be blank (or whatever is usually shown there for review overview)

*Actual behaviour*
- After removing the last revision, the file is removed from the review
- The review overview section from the navigation tree disappears
- The frx controls continue to show those of the removed file

See attachment _overview-disappears-removing-file.png_ which is a screenshot of the actual behaviour.
fields.summary: Review overview disappears when removing last file

fields.description:
As identified in [CRC-945|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-945]:

*Steps to reproduce*

# Create a review containing a single file using just the revision in which that file was added to the repository
# Use 'Edit Revisions' or the 'File Outdated' menu to add a later revision that modifies the file

*Expected*
- The revision should be added
- The colour of the filename should change from green to blue (both in the tree and in the heading above the diff)
- The description of the change next to the filename in the file controls should change from _ADDED_ to _CHANGED_.

*Actual*
- The revision is added
- Only the colour of the heading above the diff changes to blue

Attachment _file-colour-action-doesnt-update.png_ demonstrates the actual behaviour.

If you refresh the page after step 2 then the colours are correct.
fields.summary: File colour and action description doesn't dynamically update

- write a sample gadget plugin
- check that the plugin works on the JIRA dashboard
- allow gadget to use openauth
fields.summary: Allow Fisheye/Crucible to serve Gadgets

fields.description:
[FSH-2366|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-2366] describes a case where too many command line arguments are passed to the {{p4}} client, causing an error in Windows ({{CreateProcess error=87, The parameter is incorrect}}).

Windows has a limit to the length of command line when creating a process: [What is the command line length limit?|http://blogs.msdn.com/oldnewthing/archive/2003/12/10/56028.aspx]

We should pass the arguments to {{p4}} via the {{-x}} flag: http://www.perforce.com/perforce/doc.current/manuals/cmdref/o.gopts.html
fields.summary: Pass P4 client arguments through a file instead of the command line

fields.description:

Use Safari

Go to Edit Review, Change Sets

Type a change set number *which doesn't exist* into the field, press 'return'

Also reproducable from the activty stream's 'scroll to changeset' input field (e.g., https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/changelog/FE) so need to fix there, too.

fields.description:
This falls under the performance improvements umbrella.

Currently the View menu in the Crucible toolbars is built in JavaScript and inserted in to the page in a placeholder DIV that is created in the JSP.

This is done to allow customising of the content options. Fair enough, customising is neat.

Building the entire drop-down in JavaScript isn't neat though. The browser is busy trying to handle ajax calls and DOM builds and would be better suited to augmenting the drop-down than building it.

Lets build the menu on the server, where we know the user preset options, and ask the browser to only take on the burden that it must.

And lets look to see where else a similar change can be made.
fields.summary: Build View drop-down menus with JSP, not in JavaScript

fields.description:
Tom pointed out that the Repository select drop-down from the masthead wasn't actually working. (Network issues on my box meant that I could interact with the drop-down before the page reloaded, so I hadn't seen it before)

The drop-down is enabled by an AUI click event, so there's no need for a URL associated with the anchor element.

There are also some style issues that can use a nudge - extra padding above and below the list, and the trailing separator. Knock these on the head also.
fields.summary: Repository drop down not actually dropping

fields.description:
The welcome screen currently says 

"Welcome to Atlassian Crucible with FishEye .

...You are running FishEye without Crucible. Crucible is Atlassian's tool for simple lightweight code reviews. It is easy to upgrade to Crucible — why not download it today.

...
You are running Crucible 2.0.2 with FishEye 2.0.2  (build-412 2009-07-24)"

I'm confused.  Why does it say that I am running crucible with fisheye yet I am running fisheye without crucible?
fields.summary: welcome message says running crucible and fisheye but also says running fishey without crucible

fields.description:
When a comment is marked as defect and the resulting selections are made, these details are lost when the comment is posted.

Existing defects display their label and properties as normal. Can't find an existing defect I can edit to see if it loses its properties as new defects do.
fields.summary: Defect properties on comments are being lost
Be able to assign grades to a review

fields.description:
Some customers in using crucible 1.6.6 have relatively large crucible databases (400m+). 

When upgrading to 2.0.x, the upgrade process crashes due to the massive memory requirements needed to complete the upgrade process. 

For example in upgrade script 30, a new table is created for each of the existing tables (due to the table renames and restructure) which means the database blows out to twice the size it was originally. 

Customers on windows or 32bit JVMs are restricted to 2G limit (often less) and thus cannot upgrade.
fields.summary: Customers with large crucible databases, cannot upgrade to 2.0.x due to the blow out in memory requirements required to complete the upgrade scripts.

fields.description: To reproduce error make sure you have several revisions added to a code review. Adjust the browser screen

fields.description:
Currently, a review that hasn't been approved is in draft mode, however anyone with comment permission can comment on it.

It would be good to include the restriction in the permission scheme e.g able to add permission on whether a draft review can be commented on
